subject: Re: [junit] Re: the humbug dialog box,
msgSnippet: ... Hi J.B. Do you have, or know of, a Java Swing example illustrating this separation structure?  A picture paints a thousand words, but code is so much
messageBody:
--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
> Agreed, however, when I don't know what to do, I
> minimize the amount of
> untested code, which is what a thin GUI is all
> about. I don't think you
> can argue that this is a bad practice. One has to
> start somewhere.
>

Hi J.B.

Do you have, or know of, a Java Swing example
illustrating this separation structure? A picture
paints a thousand words, but code is so much easier to
read :-)

I (and another poster on java-gui-testing) were
interested in seeing a working example to better
understand this.

Cheers
Shane

--
"A word to the wise ain't necessary -- it's the stupid
ones that need the advice. " - Bill Cosby


=====

Shane Mingins
